markdownRemark.excerpt: Hello, world! I’ve recently taught myself how to set up this blog. It’s been quite a journey. I started by brushing off my rusty JavaScript skills (the last…
markdownRemark.html:
Hello, world! I’ve recently taught myself how to set up this blog. It’s been quite a journey. I started by brushing off my rusty JavaScript skills (the last time I wrote anything in JavaScript was probably 2015), sat myself in a crash course on React.js, sat myself in another crash course in gatsby.js, and started working through templates.

I found this template here, which was developed by Alexander Shelepenok: Link to Repository. I came across it, as I was looking at Victor Zhou’s website on ML, and various projects (Victor Zhou’s Website). However, the template was far too complicated for my needs. It had several features that I don’t really need with this blog (yet). Those were things such as CMS compatibility, a docker deployment system, flow, jest (for testing, though I’ll eventually need that), and more.

So, I came across this much more simple template here, which I was able to navigate much easier: Link to Repository. It was developed by Kyle Matthews, the founder of Gatsby.js. It’s much more bare-bones, and I’m planning on using my knowledge of React.js and Gatsby.js to rework this site to be more than just a blog, but a showcase of the work I’ve done.

Of course, this will be a long ongoing project that I’m working on, but I hope this site will take it’s form soon.

Until next time,

Keith Choa

frontmatter.title: Hello, World!
frontmatter.description: My process of setting up this blog
